page.title: 12The Village Green and Pond.
page.content: The Green and Pond are{amenity}areas occupying land to the east of the village .Along its perimeter there are {houses}of various ages ,including the craft centre. To the east lies the {pond}and the sandbagged bridge. The Green is 91m. by 40m., narrowing to 29m.near the pond.Along the edges of the{green}there are 35 trees, induding silver birches and beeches . Also there are wooden benches parish noticeboard , pillory and a village sign.In the north-west lies the{war {memorial}.The Green is a site for many village activities,including the annual fete. The{ecology}of the pond has been aided by the construction of an artificial island and this is now inhabited by eider and Mallard ducks.In the pond there are pike,bream and stickleback. The pond is 30m.long and 1m. deep.
